snippet: The recent surge in so-called second-screen behavior was vividly on display during the presidential debate, both on social networking sites and newer apps promoted by media companies.
abstract: Internet is speeding up the scoring of presidential debates, with social media and online forums discussing the event as it happened in real time; both professional pundits and voters voiced their opinions online as soon as the moderator Jim Lehrer began the debate.
lead_paragraph: The recent surge in so-called second-screen behavior was vividly on display during the presidential debate, both on social networking sites and newer apps promoted by media companies.

headline.seo: On Twitter and Apps, Audience at Home Scores the Debate
headline.main: Not Waiting for Pundits’ Take, Web Audience Scores the Candidates in an Instant
headline.print_headline: Not Waiting for Pundits’ Take, Web Audience Scores the Candidates in an Instant
